body_html: I have added a check for None values in the false branch. Should there also be a warning message when an ExponentialMovingAverage().average() is None, since accessing an average before any values have been applied seems like a mistake.
body_text: I have added a check for None values in the false branch.  Should there also be a warning message when an ExponentialMovingAverage().average() is None, since accessing an average before any values have been applied seems like a mistake.
body: I have added a check for None values in the false branch.  Should there also be a warning message when an ExponentialMovingAverage().average() is None, since accessing an average before any values have been applied seems like a mistake.
